text_entry: ACT I
SCENE I. London. The palace.
Enter KING HENRY, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, the EARL of WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT, and others

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So shaken as we are, so wan with care,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Find we a time for frighted peace to pant,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And breathe short-winded accents of new broils

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To be commenced in strands afar remote.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: No more the thirsty entrance of this soil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Shall daub her lips with her own children's blood;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Nor more shall trenching war channel her fields,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Nor bruise her flowerets with the armed hoofs

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of hostile paces: those opposed eyes,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which, like the meteors of a troubled heaven,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: All of one nature, of one substance bred,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Did lately meet in the intestine shock

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And furious close of civil butchery

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Shall now, in mutual well-beseeming ranks,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: March all one way and be no more opposed

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Against acquaintance, kindred and allies:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The edge of war, like an ill-sheathed knife,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: No more shall cut his master. Therefore, friends,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As far as to the sepulchre of Christ,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whose soldier now, under whose blessed cross

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: We are impressed and engaged to fight,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Forthwith a power of English shall we levy;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whose arms were moulded in their mothers' womb

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To chase these pagans in those holy fields

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Over whose acres walk'd those blessed feet

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which fourteen hundred years ago were nail'd

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For our advantage on the bitter cross.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But this our purpose now is twelve month old,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And bootless 'tis to tell you we will go:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Therefore we meet not now. Then let me hear

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of you, my gentle cousin Westmoreland,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: What yesternight our council did decree

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In forwarding this dear expedience.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: My liege, this haste was hot in question,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And many limits of the charge set down

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: But yesternight: when all athwart there came

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: A post from Wales loaden with heavy news;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Whose worst was, that the noble Mortimer,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Leading the men of Herefordshire to fight

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Against the irregular and wild Glendower,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Was by the rude hands of that Welshman taken,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: A thousand of his people butchered;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Upon whose dead corpse there was such misuse,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Such beastly shameless transformation,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: By those Welshwomen done as may not be

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Without much shame retold or spoken of.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: It seems then that the tidings of this broil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Brake off our business for the Holy Land.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: This match'd with other did, my gracious lord;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: For more uneven and unwelcome news

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Came from the north and thus it did import:

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: On Holy-rood day, the gallant Hotspur there,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Young Harry Percy and brave Archibald,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: That ever-valiant and approved Scot,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: At Holmedon met,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Where they did spend a sad and bloody hour,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: As by discharge of their artillery,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And shape of likelihood, the news was told;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: For he that brought them, in the very heat

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And pride of their contention did take horse,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Uncertain of the issue any way.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Here is a dear, a true industrious friend,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Sir Walter Blunt, new lighted from his horse.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Stain'd with the variation of each soil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Betwixt that Holmedon and this seat of ours;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And he hath brought us smooth and welcome news.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The Earl of Douglas is discomfited:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Ten thousand bold Scots, two and twenty knights,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Balk'd in their own blood did Sir Walter see

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: On Holmedon's plains. Of prisoners, Hotspur took

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Mordake the Earl of Fife, and eldest son

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To beaten Douglas; and the Earl of Athol,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of Murray, Angus, and Menteith:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And is not this an honourable spoil?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A gallant prize? ha, cousin, is it not?

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: In faith,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: It is a conquest for a prince to boast of.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Yea, there thou makest me sad and makest me sin

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In envy that my Lord Northumberland

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Should be the father to so blest a son,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A son who is the theme of honour's tongue;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Amongst a grove, the very straightest plant;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Who is sweet Fortune's minion and her pride:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whilst I, by looking on the praise of him,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: See riot and dishonour stain the brow

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of my young Harry. O that it could be proved

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That some night-tripping fairy had exchanged

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In cradle-clothes our children where they lay,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And call'd mine Percy, his Plantagenet!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Then would I have his Harry, and he mine.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But let him from my thoughts. What think you, coz,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of this young Percy's pride? the prisoners,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which he in this adventure hath surprised,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To his own use he keeps; and sends me word,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I shall have none but Mordake Earl of Fife.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: This is his uncle's teaching; this is Worcester,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Malevolent to you in all aspects;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Which makes him prune himself, and bristle up

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: The crest of youth against your dignity.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But I have sent for him to answer this;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And for this cause awhile we must neglect

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Our holy purpose to Jerusalem.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Cousin, on Wednesday next our council we

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Will hold at Windsor; so inform the lords:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But come yourself with speed to us again;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For more is to be said and to be done

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Than out of anger can be uttered.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: I will, my liege.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Exeunt
